channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Powell indicates further, smaller rate cuts, insists the Fed is 'not on any preset course'
item.description: The central bank chief asserted that he will seek to balance fighting inflation with supporting the labor market.

item.title: 'No challenges can stop China's progress' Xi Jinping says in 75th anniversary speech
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping made no mention of specific countries or trade conflicts in his Monday speech and portrayed Beijing as upholding globalization.

item.title: AI chipmaker Cerebras files for IPO to take on Nvidia
item.description: Cerebras faces competition from Nvidia, as well as cloud providers that have developed in-house chips for running artificial intelligence models.

item.title: Google to invest $1 billion in Thailand to build data center and accelerate AI growth
item.description: Google is investing 36 billion Thai baht, or $1 billion, into Thailand to build a new data center and expand its cloud infrastructure, the company said Monday.

item.title: Iran's response to Israel will be a choice between revenge and survival. Markets say it's choosing survival
item.description: Iran's leadership has vowed revenge, but its actions and language suggest — at least so far — a more measured response.

item.title: China stocks just had their best day in 16 years, sending related U.S. ETFs soaring
item.description: The Shanghai Composite rallied 8.06% in its best day since September 2008.

item.title: German inflation drops to 1.8% in September, below expectations
item.description: The harmonized German consumer price index eased to 1.8% in September, more than expected, preliminary data from the country's statistics office showed Monday.

item.title: East Coast port strike: Truckers, rails scramble to move billions in cargo before ILA union midnight shutdown
item.description: A port strike on the East and Gulf coasts is set for Tuesday, the ILA union says. Billions in trade is being rushed out by truck and rail before a shutdown.

item.title: 'Golden Week’ bookings show Chinese travel preferences are evolving
item.description: Bookings show that Chinese travelers are staying longer, traveling farther and looking for new experiences — from quiet destinations to K-pop concerts.

item.title: Rupert Murdoch’s property group REA ends chase to buy Rightmove after multiple rejected offers
item.description: Rupert Murdoch's Australian property listing firm REA Group said Monday it would no longer seek to buy UK property portal Rightmove.

item.title: Oil markets not pricing in an 'all-out war' after Israel kills Hezbollah leader, but risks persist
item.description: Oil prices barely budged after Hezbollah confirmed that its leader was killed on Friday in an Israeli airstrike in the Lebanese capital of Beirut.

item.title: Stellantis and Aston Martin shares drop sharply after profit warnings amid China woes
item.description: Stocks of European carmakers hemorrhaged early on Monday as Stellantis and British luxury brand Aston Martin issued profit warnings.

item.title: China stocks just saw their best day of trading since 2008 amid a stimulus rally
item.description: China's CSI 300 rallied 8.48%, closing at 4,017.85 for a nine-day winning streak, its best day since September 2008 and its highest point since August 2023.

item.title: Here’s why Japan’s stocks are plunging after Shigeru Ishiba’s win
item.description: Shigeru Ishida had beaten Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi in the final round of the Liberal Democratic Party election on Friday.

item.title: China's factory activity contracts less than expected in September — but shrinks for a fifth straight month
item.description: The official manufacturing purchasing managers' index came in at 49.8, slightly beating the 49.5 expected among economists polled by Reuters.

item.title: EchoStar to sell Dish to DirecTV, combining major pay-TV providers
item.description: EchoStar CEO Hamid Akhavan appeared on CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" on Monday after the company sold its video distribution business to DirecTV.

item.title: China property stocks rally after major cities ease homebuying restrictions
item.description: Shares of Chinese property developers rallied on Monday, fueled by easing homebuying measures, following authorities' blitz of policy stimulus last week.

item.title: 'Full force': Malaysia PM says crusade against corruption is not over as country courts investment
item.description: The Southeast Asian nation lost around 277 billion ringgit in economic output due to corruption from 2018 to 2023, according to official estimates.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Shiny September days for stocks
item.description: Stocks’ defiant showing this September was helped by positive sentiment generated by the U.S. Federal Reserve’s jumbo rate cut and upbeat economic data.

item.title: Netanyahu says killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in Israeli airstrike 'will not be enough'
item.description: Nasrallah has led the Lebanon-based group since 1992, taking the reins after Israel assassinated the group's previous leader, Abbas al-Musawi.

item.title: Oil alliance OPEC+ zeroes in on group compliance after postponing output hike
item.description: The OPEC+ alliance is once more angling in on group compliance with oil output cuts, amid overproduction from heavyweight members Iraq and Kazakhstan.

item.title: OpenAI sees roughly $5 billion loss this year on $3.7 billion in revenue
item.description: CNBC has confirmed that OpenAI expects about $5 billion in losses on $3.7 billion in revenue this year — figures first reported by The New York Times.

item.title: Major CVS shareholder plans activist push, will meet with management, sources say
item.description: Glenview Capital is expected to meet with CVS management on Monday to discuss its plans for value creation at the struggling business.

item.title: Mark Cuban warns Elon Musk: Trump’s ‘loyalty is only to himself'
item.description: Mark Cuban is supporting Vice President Kamala Harris, while Elon Musk has endorsed ex-President Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

item.title: Elon Musk's X will be allowed back online in Brazil after paying one more fine
item.description: X has to pay one last fine before getting reinstated in Brazil, according to a decision out Friday from the country's top justice, Alexandre de Moraes.

item.title: UK PM Keir Starmer touts pro-business agenda as he woos top Wall Street CEOs
item.description: "We now have a Labour government whose number one priority is wealth creation," U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer told CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin.

item.title: European shares close at record high; luxury giants rally on China stimulus
item.description: European markets closed at a record high Friday, as stocks tracked higher on news of China's stimulus blitz and investors assessed fresh inflation data.

item.title: Hands-on with Meta's Orion AR glasses prototype and the possible future of computing
item.description: CNBC senior media and tech correspondent Julia Boorstin experienced Meta's Orion AR glasses prototype, and was impressed by how lightweight they were.

item.title: Key Fed inflation gauge at 2.2% in August, lower than expected
item.description: The personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.1% in August and 2.3% from a year ago.

item.title: Trump calls for prosecution of Google over search results he says favor Harris
item.description: Donald Trump claimed Google was showing only "good stories" about Vice President Kamala Harris, his presidential election opponent.
